snippet: The bank’s agreement with industry regulators stems from accusations that it misrepresented the risk of Puerto Rico bonds to clients on the island.
abstract: Financial Industry Regulatory Authority says Santander Securities, subsidiary of Banco Santander operating in Puerto Rico, will pay $4.3 million to clients on island who lost money on Puerto Rican bonds, and will also pay fine of $2 million for failing to supervise employees properly; it is second time in month financial institution has settled accusations of violating rules regarding selling of island's bonds.
lead_paragraph: The bank’s agreement with industry regulators stems from accusations that it misrepresented the risk of Puerto Rico bonds to clients on the island.

headline.main: Santander to Pay $6.4 Million in Puerto Rico Bond Settlement
headline.print_headline: Santander to Pay $6.4 Million to Islanders in Puerto Rico Bond Settlement
